Services Bootstrap Oracle Weblogic UNIX JUnit Java Developer Citi Markets and Banking Township of Warren NJ November 2017 to December 2018 Description With implementation of the GICAP BPM toolXM the Fixed Income business will have a platform for identifying processing and monitoring exceptions and fails for US Government securities and Mortgagebacked securities that clear through BONY and the FED Trades for US Government and MortgageBacked securities are entered and captured into several frontend trade capture systems These trades are enriched by the TES application before being processed by further downstream applications for clearance and settlement Government Securities Clearing Corporation GSCC eligible trades are submitted directly to GSCC for trade matching and netting Trades that are not GSCCeligible are submitted to the GCS application The GCS application will route trades to the Bank of New York BONY Citigroups clearing agent for US Government and MortgageBacked securities Responsibilities Involved in Business Process design and development using oracle BPM toolALBPM Design and development of Hibernate DAO layer for the application Design and developed Web services based on SOAP WSDL JAXWS Involved in designing the xml schema for using web services Created JSP page to modify log levels dynamically without restarting the server Involved in creating automated builds using ANT to builddeploy onto weblogic server Implemented Test First unit testing framework driven using JUnit Developed and utilized J2EE Services and JMS components for messaging communication in WebLogic Configured development environment using Weblogic application server for developers integration testing Integrated User interface server layer persistence layer using Spring IOC AOP and Spring MVC integration with OBPM Spring integration with Hibernate Developed dynamic proxies to consume the web services developed in JAXWS standards for CRM module Published JAXWS based web services where in all the requests will be routed to this Single Point service and based on the request they are forwarded to the corresponding legacy operations Environment JDK 15 JSP JSTL Tag libraries CSS DHTML JavaScript JSON jQuery Servlets Spring MVC Java Beans Hibernate JPA Web Services JAXWS Web Sphere Application Server 70 Oracle Weblogic 103 UNIX JUnit Java Developer FIMBANK IN January 2015 to November 2017 Description KASTLETM Factoring an endtoend webbased solution caters to factoring and invoice discounting businesses and provides complete business coverage KASTLETM Factoring supports a complete range of activities for effective asset tracking and management It enables setting up of client account facilitates invoices upload and validations calculation of availability fees and charges taxes and duties payable disbursement transfers receipts and appropriation accrual of interest generating accounting entries and MIS Transfer accounting required entries using their HOST system through Interface Responsibilities Developed the application under JEE architecture developed Designed dynamic and browser compatible user interfaces using JSP Custom Tags using JUnit Developed and utilized J2EE Services and JMS components for messaging communication in WebLogic Configured development environment using Weblogic application server for developers
